title: Yusuke Minoguchi
text:
is a former <a href="Japan">Japan</a>ese <a href="Association%20football">football</a> player.
Club career.
Minoguchi was born in <a href="Hokkaido">Hokkaido</a> on 23 August 1965. After graduating from <a href="Kokushikan%20University">Kokushikan University</a>, he joined <a href="JEF%20United%20Chiba">Furukawa Electric</a> (later "JEF United Ichihara") in 1988. He played 67 games and scored 14 goals in <a href="Japan%20Soccer%20League">Japan Soccer League</a>. From 1993, he played for <a href="Japan%20Football%20League%20%281992%E2%80%9398%29">Japan Football League</a> club <a href="Sagan%20Tosu">PJM Futures</a> (1993-1994), <a href="Avispa%20Fukuoka">Fukuoka Blux</a> (1995) and <a href="Oita%20Trinita">Oita Trinity</a> (1996).
National team career.
In 1988, Minoguchi was selected <a href="Japan%20national%20football%20team">Japan national "B team"</a> for <a href="1988%20AFC%20Asian%20Cup">1988 Asian Cup</a>. At this competition, he played 2 games. However, <a href="Japan%20Football%20Association">Japan Football Association</a> don't count as Japan national team match because this Japan team was "B team" not "top team"
